member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings
member.summary: The class provides data for the animation to Dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start the animation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the dialog. If the user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component has received parameters from its parent.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.
member.param: Boolean value to dispose the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton
member.summary: Provides data to configure the Dialog button properties.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the Spinner element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.Content
member.summary: Defines the text `content` of the Button element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.CssClass
member.summary: Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space in the Button element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the Button is `disabled`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IconCss
member.summary: Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the Button that is used to include an icon.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IconPosition
member.summary: Positions the icon before or after the text content in the Button. The possible values are: Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content. Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IsPrimary
member.summary: Allows the appearance of the Button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IsToggle
member.summary: Makes the Button toggle, when set to `true`. When you click it, the state changes from normal to active.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.OnClick
member.summary: Event triggers when `click` the dialog button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of the button. Possible values are Button, Submit, and Reset.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IsFlat
member.summary: Specifies the Flat appearance of the dialog buttons.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as id, title etc., to the button element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component has received parameters from its parent.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.
member.param: Boolean value to dispose the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButtons
member.summary: A list of buttons that are used to configure the Dialog buttons.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButtons.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the Dialog Button element.

member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.
member.param: Boolean value to dispose the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents
member.summary: Configure handlers to handle the events with the Dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.Closed
member.summary: Event triggers after the dialog has been closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.Created
member.summary: Event triggers when the dialog is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.Destroyed
member.summary: Event triggers when the dialog is destroyed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnClose
member.summary: Event triggers before the dialog is closed. If you cancel this event, the dialog remains opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnDrag
member.summary: Event triggers when the user drags the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnDragStart
member.summary: Event triggers when the user begins dragging the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnDragStop
member.summary: Event triggers when the user stops dragging the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnOpen
member.summary: Event triggers when the dialog is being opened. If you cancel this event, the dialog remains closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnOverlayModalClick
member.summary: Event triggers when the overlay of the dialog is clicked.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnResizeStart
member.summary: Event triggers when the user begins to resize a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnResizeStop
member.summary: Event triggers when the user stops to resize a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.Opened
member.summary: Event triggers when a dialog is opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.Resizing
member.summary: Event triggers when the user resizes the dialog.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogEvents.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.
member.param: Boolean value to dispose the object.

member.summary: Specifies the offset left value to position the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogPositionData.Y

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogTemplates
member.summary: Configure templates to display within a header, content, and footer section of Dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogTemplates.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with a plain text. The dialog will be displayed without the header if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogTemplates.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's content section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogTemplates.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the footer template of the dialog.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogTemplates.OnInitialized
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogTemplates.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogTemplates.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the unmanaged resources.
member.param: Boolean value to dispose the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog
member.summary: Represents the dialog component that displays the information and gets input from the user. Two types of dialog components are `Modal and Modeless(non-modal)` depending on their interaction with the parent application.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component has received parameters from its parent.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.OnAfterRenderAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method invoked after each time the component has been rendered.
member.param: Set to true if this is the first time OnAfterRender(Boolean) has been invoked.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ID
member.summary: Specifies the unique identifier.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ChildContent
member.summary: Sets content for the Dialog element including HTML support and its customizations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.AllowDragging
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user. The dialog allows a user to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-positioning the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be closed on pressing the escape (ESC) key. that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's content section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnableResize
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If the enableResize is true, the dialog component creates a grip to resize it in a diagonal direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ResizeHandles
member.summary: Specifies the resize handles direction in the dialog component that can be resized by the end-user.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with the dialog's footer area. This is an optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with the action buttons. If the footer template is configured to the dialog, the buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with a plain text. The dialog will be displayed without the header if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the dialog element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.IsModal
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates an overlay that disables interaction with the parent application and the user who should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with the parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.MinHeight
member.summary: Specifies the min-height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ShowCloseIcon
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon can be shown in the dialog’s title section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target element in which the dialog should be displayed. The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Visible
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.VisibleChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed in front or behind of another component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.AllowPrerender
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Dialog element re-render or not when the Dialog gets open.
member.value: true, if dialog component elements are maintained on the DOM when closing and opening it; otherwise, false.The default value is false.
member.remarks: Disabling this property, the Dialog component DOM element will be destroyed when closing and re-rendered the dialog DOM element while opening it. Otherwise, the dialog will be shown when opening it and remain hidden while closing it when enabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.GetButton(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the dialog button instances by index. Based on that, you can dynamically change the button states.
member.returns: Returns the dialog button instances by index.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.GetButtonItems
member.summary: Returns all the dialog button’s instances which are rendered in the dialog’s footer. Based on that, you can dynamically change the buttons states.
member.returns: Returns all the dialog button’s instances.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.HideAsync
member.summary: Overloaded. Closes the dialog if it is in a visible state.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.HideAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Overloaded. Closes the dialog if it is in a visible state.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Overloaded. Closes the dialog if it is in a visible state.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.HideAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs)
member.summary: Overloaded. Closes the dialog if it is in a visible state.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.RefreshPositionAsync
member.summary: Refreshes the dialog's position when the user changes its height and width dynamically.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ShowAsync(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Opens the dialog if it is in a hidden state. To open the dialog with full-screen width, set the parameter as true.
member.param: Specifies dialog will open on full screen or not.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.Task representing any asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Provides the current Height and Width of the dialog.
member.returns: A System.Threading.Tasks.DialogDimension representing any asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Method invoked after component has been rendered.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.BeforeCloseEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the BeforeClose event.

member.summary: Returns the original event arguments when triggering the event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.BeforeCloseEventArgs.IsInteracted

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.BeforeOpenEventArgs.MaxHeight
member.summary: Specifies the value to override the max height of dialog.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogProvider
member.summary: DialogProvider is a target element where the built-in dialogs are shown using , and methods that are appended to this element.
member.remarks: It is recommended to add this component in `MainLayout.razor` to show utility dialogs from anywhere in the application. If you add this to any particular page, the utility dialogs can then be displayed only for that page.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService
member.summary: A class that represents the dialog utility service which is used to configure built-in dialog options.
member.remarks: can be injected using `@inject SfDialogService DialogService` in any page to show the built-in dialogs.

member.name: E:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.OnOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the event callback that will be invoked before the dialog opens and closes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.ConfirmAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)
member.summary: Opens a confirmation dialog box with two buttons as OK and Cancel.
member.param: A string specifies the text to be displayed in the confirmation dialog.
Optional. A string specifies the title to be displayed in the confirmation dialog.
Optional. A specifies the options to configure confirm dialog.
member.returns: Returns a boolean value which specifies which button is clicked by user. true, if the user clicked `OK` button; Otherwise false.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.AlertAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)
member.summary: Opens an alert dialog box which is used to display warning messages to the users.
member.param: A string specifies the text to be displayed in the alert dialog.
Optional. A string specifies the title to be displayed in the alert dialog.
Optional. A specifies the options to configure alert dialog.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.PromptAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)
member.summary: Opens a prompt dialog that prompts the user to input text. Where the user enters a string content, it returns when clicked OK and null when clicked Cancel.
member.param: A string specifies the text to be displayed in the prompt dialog.
Optional. A string specifies the title to be displayed in the prompt dialog.
Optional. A specifies the options to configure prompt dialog.
member.returns: Returns a string entered by the user when the user clicks `OK`; Otherwise `null`.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions
member.summary: Provides options to configure built-in dialogs shown using , and methods.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.AllowDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the dialog can be dragged by the end-user.
member.value: true, if the dialog can be dragged by the user; Otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When is set as true it allows a user to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for repositioning the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.ShowCloseIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show the close icon in the title of dialog.
member.value: true, the close icon is displayed in the dialog title section; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the dialog can be closed by pressing the escape (ESC) key.
member.value: true, if the dialog can be closed by pressing the escape (ESC) key; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the utility dialog.
member.remarks: One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a utility dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the dialog..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the dialog..

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.ZIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the z-order that determines whether the utility dialog is displayed in front or behind of another component.
member.value: The `ZIndex` value range can be changed depending on the application's needs. The default value is 1000.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the value where the utility dialog can be positioned within the document or target.
member.value: The position can be represented with pre-configured positions or specific X and Y values. PositionDataModel.X can be configured with a left, center, right, or offset value. PositionDataModel.Y can be configured with a top, center, bottom, or offset value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.AnimationSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation settings of the dialog component.
member.remarks: The animation effect can be applied to open and close the dialog with duration and delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.PrimaryButtonOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the primary (OK) action button settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.CancelButtonOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the cancel action settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a template content that used as content dialog.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButtonOptions
member.summary: Provides options to configure dialog buttons of built-in dialogs shown using , and methods.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButtonOptions.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the text content of the button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButtonOptions.IconCss
member.summary: Gets or sets one or more CSS classes to include an icon or image for the Button.
member.value: Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is String.Empty.
member.remarks: Buttons can also include font icon and sprite image.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButtonOptions.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Button is enabled or disabled.
member.value: true, the button is disabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationOptions
member.summary: The animation options for the built-in dialogs is shown using , and methods.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationOptions.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds to start the animation.
member.value: The amount of time in milliseconds to delay animation before start.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationOptions.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.
member.value: The amount of time in milliseconds to complete animation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationOptions.Effect
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation effect to apply when open and close the dialog. If the user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect.
member.value: The following are the list of animation effects available to configure: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None.

member.summary: Tooltip open/close actions occur with the FadeOut animation effect.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode
member.summary: To set the open modes available for the Tooltip.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Auto
member.summary: In Auto mode, the tooltip appears when you hover over the target or when the target element receives the focus. In mobile devices, the tooltip opens on tap and hold of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Hover
member.summary: In Hover mode, the tooltip appears when you hover over the target on the desktop. In mobile devices, the tooltip opens on a tap and hold of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Click
member.summary: In Click mode, the tooltip appears when you click a target element on the desktop. In mobile devices, Tooltip appears with a single tap on the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Focus
member.summary: In Focus mode, Tooltip appears when you focus on a target element in desktop. In mobile devices, Tooltip appears with a single tap on the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.OpenMode.Custom
member.summary: In Custom mode, the tooltip will not appear on any default action. You have to bind your custom events and use either open or close public methods in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position
member.summary: To set the applicable positions where the Tooltip can be displayed over specific target elements.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position.TopCenter

member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the bottom-center of the target element.

member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the bottom-right of the target element.

member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the left-top of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position.LeftCenter
member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the left-center of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position.LeftBottom
member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the left-bottom of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position.RightTop
member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the right-top of the target element.

member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the right-center of the target element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position.RightBottom
member.summary: Positions the Tooltip to the right-bottom of the target element.

member.summary: Applicable tip positions are attached to the Tooltip.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TipPointerPosition.Auto
member.summary: Automatically adjusts the tip pointer position.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TipPointerPosition.Start
member.summary: Positions the tip pointer at the start of the Tooltip element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TipPointerPosition.Middle
member.summary: Positions the tip pointer in the middle of the Tooltip element.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TipPointerPosition.End
member.summary: Positions the tip pointer at the end of the Tooltip element.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings
member.summary: Animation options that are common for both open and close actions of the Tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings.Delay
member.summary: It is used to denote the delay value in milliseconds and indicating the waiting time before the animation begins.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings.Duration
member.summary: It is used to denote the duration of the animation that is completed per the animation cycle.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: It is used to apply the Animation effect on the Tooltip, during open and close actions.

member.summary: It is used to denote the Tooltip element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipEventArgs.Left
member.summary: Specifies the clientX position of the target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipEventArgs.IsInteracted
member.summary: If the event is triggered by interaction, it returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipEventArgs.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipEventArgs.Type

member.summary: The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Closed
member.summary: The event `Closed` will be fired when the Tooltip component gets closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Opened
member.summary: The event `Opened` will be fired after the Tooltip component gets opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnClose
member.summary: The event `OnClose` will be fired before the Tooltip hides from the screen. The Tooltip close can be prevented by setting the cancel argument value to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnCollision
member.summary: The event `OnCollision` will be fired for every collision fit calculation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnOpen
member.summary: The event `OnOpen` will be fired before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented. This event is mainly used to refresh the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnRender
member.summary: The event `OnRender` will be fired before the Tooltip and its contents will be added to the DOM. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page. This event is mainly used to customize the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen. For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Created
member.summary: The event `Created` will be fired after the Tooltip component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Destroyed
member.summary: The event `Destroyed` will be fired when the Tooltip component is destroyed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnInitializedAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnParametersSetAsync
member.summary: Method invoked when any changes in component state occurs.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OnAfterRenderAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method invoked after each time the component has been rendered.
member.param: Set to true for the first time component rendering; otherwise gets false.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the content which has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ID
member.summary: Defines the Id of the Tooltip component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Defines the content template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Animation
member.summary: It is used to customize the animation of the Tooltip while opening and closing. The animation property also allows you to set delay, duration, and various other effects of your choice. You can set the same or different animation options to the Tooltip when it is in the open or close state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.CloseDelay
member.summary: To close the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Content
member.summary: To display the content of the Tooltip which can be a string element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.CssClass
member.summary: To customize the Tooltip which accepts the custom CSS class names that define specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied to the Tooltip element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: This property has been deprecated as we achieve this behavior by using ChildContent of render fragment type and and Content as a string value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.EnablePersistence
member.summary: As there are no properties required to persist in tooltip component, this property is deprecated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.EnableRtl
member.summary: To enable or disable the rendering component in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.WindowCollision
member.summary: It is used to set the collision target element as page viewport (window) or Tooltip element, when using the target. If this property is enabled, tooltip will perform the collision calculation between the target elements. and viewport(window) instead of Tooltip element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Height
member.summary: To set the height of the Tooltip component which accepts the string values. When the Tooltip content gets overflowed due to the height value, then the scroll mode will be enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.IsSticky
member.summary: To display the Tooltip in an open state until it is closed manually.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.MouseTrail
member.summary: It allows the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer moves over the specified target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OffsetX
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in X-axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OffsetY
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in Y-axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OpenDelay
member.summary: To open the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OpensOn
member.summary: To determine the type of open mode to display the Tooltip content. The available open modes are Auto, Hover, Click, Focus, and Custom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Position
member.summary: To set the position of the Tooltip element with respect to the Target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.ShowTipPointer
member.summary: To show or hide the tip pointer of the Tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Target
member.summary: To denote the target selector where the Tooltip needs to be displayed. The target element is considered as the parent container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Container
member.summary: It is used to set the container element in which the Tooltip’s pop-up will be appended. It's default value is `body`, in which the Tooltip’s pop-up will be appended.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.TipPointerPosition
member.summary: It is used to customize the position of the tip pointer on the tooltip. The available options are Auto, Start, Middle, and End. When set to auto, the tip pointer gets auto adjusted within the space of the target's length and does not point outside.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Width
member.summary: To set the width of the Tooltip component which accepts a string value. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.TooltipHtmlAttributes
member.summary: Adds the additional html attributes to the Tooltip element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Open(System.Nullable{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference},Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings)
member.summary: It is used to show the Tooltip on the specified target with specific animation settings. You can also pass the additional arguments like target element in which the tooltip should appear and animation settings for the tooltip open action.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.OpenAsync(System.Nullable{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference},Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings)
member.summary: It is used to show the Tooltip on the specified target with specific animation settings. You can also pass the additional arguments like target element in which the tooltip should appear and animation settings for the tooltip open action.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Close(Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings)
member.summary: It is used to hide the Tooltip with a specific animation effect. You can pass the animation settings for tooltip close action.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.CloseAsync(Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipAnimationSettings)
member.summary: It is used to hide the Tooltip with a specific animation effect. You can pass the animation settings for tooltip close action.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh the tooltip component when the target element is dynamically used.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.RefreshAsync
member.summary: Refresh the tooltip component when the target element is dynamically used.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.RefreshPosition(System.Nullable{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference})
member.summary: Dynamically refreshes the tooltip element position based on the target element.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.RefreshPositionAsync(System.Nullable{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference})
member.summary: Dynamically refreshes the tooltip element position based on the target element.
member.returns: ="Task".

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipTemplates
member.summary: Configure templates to display content within the tooltip component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipTemplates.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the content which has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipTemplates.Content
member.summary: Defines the content to be passed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TooltipTemplates.OnInitialized
member.summary: Method invoked when the component is ready to start.
